basics.name: Hugo Blanc
basics.label: PhD Candidate in Computer Vision and 3D Reconstruction
basics.summary: PhD candidate in 3D computer vision and differentiable rendering, focusing on Gaussian and RBF-based volumetric representations for 3D scene reconstruction and photorealistic novel view synthesis.

work.name: Mines Paris – CAOR
work.position: PhD Candidate in 3D Computer Vision and Rendering
work.summary: Research on 3D scene reconstruction from images using local Gaussian and RBF-based volumetric representations, with a focus on novel view synthesis and implicit scene representations.
highlights: Main research contributions include RayGauss (volumetric Gaussian-based ray casting) and RayGaussX (accelerated Gaussian-based ray marching).
Developing a global implicit surface model from local RBFs for accurate, BVH-accelerated geometry reconstruction.
Daily development in Unix/Linux with C++, Python, CUDA and OptiX; extensive use of PyTorch, OpenCV and git.

work.name: Mines Paris – CAOR
work.summary: Research intern on accelerating NeRF-style volumetric rendering for interactive novel view synthesis, leveraging camera pose optimisation and 3D point cloud data (LiDAR / MVS).
highlights: Explored strategies to combine NeRF-style rendering with LiDAR / MVS point cloud priors.
Worked on camera pose optimisation for interactive novel view synthesis.

work.name: University of Cambridge
work.summary: Research assistant on hyperspectral image classification with limited labelled data.
highlights: Developed methods for hyperspectral image classification in low-label regimes.

work.name: Forum Trium
work.summary: Organised a company career forum for engineering students.
highlights: Contacted and recruited partner companies for the forum.
Coordinated event logistics and interactions with engineering schools.

volunteer.summary: Public demonstrations of 3D reconstruction and rendering research during the European Heritage Days at Mines Paris.
highlights: Explained research topics in 3D computer vision and rendering to a broad public audience.

courses: Convex Optimization and Applications in Machine Learning

awards.title: Best Paper Award – WACV 2025
awards.awarder: IEEE/CVF Winter Conference on Applications of Computer Vision (WACV)
awards.summary: Best Paper Award for 'RayGauss: Volumetric Gaussian-Based Ray Casting for Photorealistic Novel View Synthesis'.

publications.name: RayGauss: Volumetric Gaussian-Based Ray Casting for Photorealistic Novel View Synthesis
publications.summary: Introduces a volumetric Gaussian-based ray casting method that improves both quality and efficiency for photorealistic novel view synthesis compared to Neural Radiance Fields and 3D Gaussian Splatting.

publications.name: RayGaussX: Accelerating Gaussian-Based Ray Marching for Real-Time and High-Quality Novel View Synthesis
publications.summary: Presents an accelerated Gaussian-based ray marching approach enabling real-time and high-quality novel view synthesis.

publications.name: Global Implicit Surface Representation from Local RBFs for Differentiable Rendering
publications.summary: Proposes a global implicit surface model built from local RBFs for accurate, BVH-accelerated geometry reconstruction and differentiable rendering.

projects.name: RayGauss
projects.summary: Volumetric Gaussian-based ray casting method for photorealistic novel view synthesis, improving both quality and efficiency over Neural Radiance Fields and 3D Gaussian Splatting.
highlights: Public project page with results and code.

projects.name: RayGaussX
projects.summary: Accelerated Gaussian-based ray marching approach designed for real-time and high-quality novel view synthesis.
highlights: Demonstrates real-time rendering capabilities on complex 3D scenes.

projects.name: Global implicit surface representation from local RBFs
projects.summary: Global implicit surface model built from local RBF representations, combined with BVH acceleration structures for accurate and efficient geometry reconstruction.
highlights: Designed for differentiable rendering and high-fidelity geometry reconstruction.
Under review at a top-tier computer vision conference.
